newsitem.title: USA: Micron sees Q2 gain, DRAM prices recently up.
newsitem.headline: Micron sees Q2 gain, DRAM prices recently up.

text.p: Micron Technology Inc Chairman and Chief Executive Steven Appleton said that the company expects to record a gain in the second quarter as a result of its recent completion of a secondary offering for Micron Electronics Inc.
Appleton said that the company could see a gain of about $0.50 in the quarter, but he cautioned that that number is an off-the-cuff estimate.
He also said the company has not yet allocated what to do with the funds that were generated from the offering.
Micron Technology, which is a developer of computer memory chips, will still own about 65 percent of Micron Electronics, which is a direct marketer of personal computers.
Appleton also said that the current trend in DRAM pricing has been up in the past month, but he declined to predict if that trend would continue.
Appleton said DRAM prices were up slightly in November, then trailed back down again in December and in January they were up again.
"But (pricing) has not been up that much," he said.
DRAM (Dynamic Random Access Memory) chips are the biggest semiconductor component of personal computers.
